titles: A most excellent new ballad, of an olde man and his wife which in their olde age and misery sought to their owne children for succour, by whom they were disdained & scornfully sent away succourlesse, and how the vengeancc [sic] of God was iustly shewed vpon them for the same. To the tune of Prissilla.
notes: Verse - "It was an old man, which with his poore wife,".
Publisher's name supplied and publication date estimated by STC.
